messages.subject: Re:Bertie Bott
messages.msgSnippet: Patrick says the new Vomit flavor is pretty gross, but it doesn t really taste like vomit. It s only in the new boxes, not the bags, along with the new
messages.messageBody:
Patrick says the new Vomit flavor "is pretty gross, but it doesn't really
taste like vomit." It's only in the new boxes, not the bags, along with the
new Earwax, Dirt, and Spinach flavors.

Deborah in IL

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re:Bertie Bott
messages.msgSnippet: We found some at the Winn Dixie grocery stroe. The new ones, in a box, are expensive.  I found the fist batch (in cute little draw string bags) at Walmart. The
messages.messageBody:
We found some at the Winn Dixie grocery stroe. The new
ones, in a box, are expensive. I found the fist batch
(in cute little draw string bags) at Walmart. The
first ones were only 25 (I just realized my computer
keyboard has no cents sign!!) cents. There was a
flavor key included.

Sharon of the Swamp

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re:Bertie Bott
messages.msgSnippet: ... Vomit was originally Pizza - at least, they were trying to make a pizza-flavored jelly belly and came up with one to try, but everyone who tested it
messages.messageBody:
On Sun, 1 Sep 2002 00:23:24 EDT dacunefare@... writes:
> Patrick says the new Vomit flavor "is pretty gross, but it doesn't
> really
> taste like vomit."

Vomit was originally Pizza - at least, they were trying to make a
pizza-flavored jelly belly and came up with one to try, but everyone who
tested it thought it was gross. So they shelved it for a while... then
when they started the Bertie Botts they remembered it, pulled it out, and
renamed it Vomit.

An interesting tidbit Rain learned on her last factory tour... she likes
to chat it up with the guides.

Dar
